com.gotenna.sdk.utils

Class EndianUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gotenna.sdk.utils.EndianUtils

  • public class EndianUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    A helper class for converting ints/longs to bytes and ensuring their Endian order. Also converts bytes into ints/longs ensuring Endian order. Created on 12/11/15.

    • Method Detail

      • boolToBigEndian

        public static byte boolToBigEndian(boolean boolFlag)
        Converts a boolean to is BigEndian byte ordering if necessary. True = 0x01, False = 0x00
        Parameters:
        boolFlag - The boolean to convert to a byte.
        Returns:
        The byte indicating the flag's value.

      • doubleToBigEndianBytes

        public static byte[] doubleToBigEndianBytes(double doubleValue)
        Converts a double to its BigEndian byte ordering if necessary.
        Parameters:
        doubleValue - The double to convert to bytes.
        Returns:
        The bytes that represent the double in BigEndian format.

      • longToBigEndianBytes

        public static byte[] longToBigEndianBytes(long longValue)
        Converts a long to its BigEndian byte ordering if necessary.
        Parameters:
        longValue - The long to convert to bytes
        Returns:
        The bytes that represent the long in BigEndian format.

      • integerToBigEndianBytes

        public static byte[] integerToBigEndianBytes(int integer)
        Converts an integer to its BigEndian byte ordering if necessary.
        Parameters:
        integer - The integer to convert to bytes
        Returns:
        The bytes that represent the integer in BigEndian format.

      • integerToBigEndianBytes

        public static byte[] integerToBigEndianBytes(int integer,
                                             int byteCount)
        Converts an integer to its BigEndian byte ordering if necessary. Can target a specific byte count if you know your integer will only require a certain number of bytes.
        Parameters:
        integer - The integer to convert to bytes
        byteCount - The number of bytes needed to represent the integer.
        Returns:
        The bytes that represent the integer in BigEndian format, truncated using the byte count.

      • shortToBigEndianBytes

        public static byte[] shortToBigEndianBytes(short shortValue)
        Converts a short to its BigEndian byte ordering if necessary.
        Parameters:
        shortValue - The short to convert to bytes.
        Returns:
        The bytes that represent the short in BigEndian format.

      • bytesToBoolean

        public static boolean bytesToBoolean(byte[] bytes)
        Converts an array of bytes in BigEndian format to its boolean representation. Bytes array should only contain 1 byte. True = 0x01, False = 0x00
        Parameters:
        bytes -
        Returns:

      • bytesToDouble

        public static double bytesToDouble(byte[] bytes)
        Converts an array of bytes in BigEndian format to its double representation. Will pad the byte representation with extra empty bytes if the supplied bytes are not large enough. i.e.) A double is fully represented by 8 bytes, but you can supply an array that contains less than 8 bytes.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes in BigEndian format to convert.
        Returns:
        The double representation of the bytes.

      • bytesToLong

        public static long bytesToLong(byte[] bytes)
        Converts an array of bytes in BigEndian format to its long representation. Will pad the byte representation with extra empty bytes if the supplied bytes are not large enough. i.e.) A long is fully represented by 8 bytes, but you can supply an array that contains less than 8 bytes.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes in BigEndian format to convert.
        Returns:
        The long representation of the bytes.

      • bytesToInteger

        public static int bytesToInteger(byte[] bytes)
        Converts an array of bytes in BigEndian format to its integer representation. Will pad the byte representation with extra empty bytes if the supplied bytes are not large enough. i.e.) An integer is fully represented by 4 bytes, but you can supply an array that contains less than 4 bytes.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes in BigEndian format to convert.
        Returns:
        The integer representation of the bytes.

      • bytesToShort

        public static short bytesToShort(byte[] bytes)
        Converts an array of bytes in BigEndian format to its double representation. Will pad the byte representation with extra empty bytes if the supplied bytes are not large enough. i.e.) A short is fully represented by 2 bytes, but you can supply an array that contains less than 2 bytes.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes in BigEndian format to convert.
        Returns:
        The short representation of the bytes.

      • integerMinByteCount

        public static int integerMinByteCount(int integer)
        Determines the minimum amount of bytes that can be used to represent an integer. i.e.) An integer with a value from 0 - 255 or can be represented by 1 byte. Warning: Untested with negative integers.
        Parameters:
        integer - The integer you want to determine the byte count of.
        Returns:
        The byte count.
